Detailed Description

template<typename LowerType, typename UpperType, typename LowerExclType, typename UpperExclType, typename CompareType>
class boost::constrained_value::within_bounds< LowerType, UpperType, LowerExclType, UpperExclType, CompareType >

Class template for value-within-bounds predicates.

Generated classes are predicates telling whether a value lays within the range defined by the given bounds. The bounds may be included or excluded from the range, as specified by the exclusion indicators.

When the range specified by within_bounds object is invalid (e.g., the upper bound is less than the lower bound), the object will report every value as not being within the allowed range. Note, however, that this class does not provide any mechanism of validating the range, since the comparison predicate is not required to be able to compare objects of the bounds' types with each other.

Parameters:
LowerType Type of the lower bound.
UpperType Type of the upper bound.
LowerExclType Type of object Convertible to bool indicating whether the lower bound is excluded from the allowed range.
UpperExclType Type of object Convertible to bool indicating whether the upper bound is excluded from the allowed range.
CompareType Type of BinaryPredicate comparing the bounds with values passed as arguments of the member template functions. If it is a function objects class, it must have const invocation operator. The comparison must induce strict weak ordering.
Remarks:
  • Models UnaryPredicate.
  • Provides implicitly-declared special member functions apart from default constructor, but only when all the template actual parameters provide the corresponding functions too.
  • Actual template parameters are inherited (unpublicly) to make possible use of Empty Base Optimization.
